comments: Faceted Project Framework's version expressions currently require that all versions referenced in an expression have to exist. This is undesirable in certain circumstances. For instance, a runtime might want to declare that it supports facet A version 1.0 or higher, but version 1.0 of the facet might not exist in all installations.

How about the range expression [2.5] as given below. 


   <project-facet-version facet="jst.web" version="2.5">
      <constraint>
        <and>
          <requires facet="jst.java" version="[1.3"/>
          <conflicts group="modules"/>
        </and>
      </constraint>
      <group-member id="modules"/>
    </project-facet-version>
 
   <extension point="org.eclipse.wst.common.project.facet.core.facets">
    <action facet="jst.web" version="[2.5]" type="INSTALL" id="jst.web#[2.5]#install">
      <delegate class="org.eclipse.jst.jee.web.project.facet.WebFacetInstallDelegate"/>
      <config-factory class="org.eclipse.jst.jee.web.project.facet.WebFacetInstallDataModelProvider"/>
    </action>
   </extension>
 

Is this not valid ?
The version expression says [ is an inclusive range, so [2.5] should be valid right ?

Currently I get this exception 

org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException: Version expression "[2.5]" is invalid.
	at org.eclipse.wst.common.project.facet.core.internal.VersionExpr.createInvalidVersionExprException(VersionExpr.java:563)
	at org.eclipse.wst.common.project.facet.core.internal.VersionExpr.<init>(VersionExpr.java:181)
	at org.eclipse.wst.common.project.facet.core.internal.ProjectFacetsManagerImpl.readEventHandler(ProjectFacetsManagerImpl.java:1916)
	at org.eclipse.wst.common.project.facet.core.internal.ProjectFacetsManagerImpl.readEventHandler(ProjectFacetsManagerImpl.java:1873)
	at org.eclipse.wst.

I wanted it extensible so that in the future it can easily be edited to
say for eg. [2.5-3.0]
However, its not as important for me as I can change [2.5] to 2.5.
But just wondering ?

Well I am guessing your explanation is that with ( or [  expressions, there has to be a upper bound, if you provide the corresponding ) or ] bracket. Can this information be added to the description somewhere.
The fix for this issue is ready. Regarding the side issue in Comment #1 and Comment #2, a range requires both end points. I don't see much value in allowing "[2.5]" syntax.
Released this work into the M6 code stream...
